pullRequest.body:
`IsLocalization.tensorSelfAlgEquiv`: If A is a localization of a commutative ring R, then `A âŠ—[R] A` is canonically isomorphic to `A` as `A`-algebras via multiplication. To construct the isomorphism we introduce a stronger version of `Algebra.TensorProduct.lmul'`.

Also add some easy theorem (`linearMap_compatibleSMul`) and defs (`distribBaseChange`, `LinearEquiv.baseChange`) and protect `IsLocalization.map_smul`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [122e2c73e3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18744/commits/122e2c73e3564888406329e68a5daab6ca22e793)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.LinearEquiv.baseChange`
`+ bijective_linearMap_mul'`
`+ distribBaseChange`
`+ equivOfCompatibleSMul`
`+ linearMap_compatibleSMul`
`+ lmul''`
`+ lmulEquiv`
`+ mapOfCompatibleSMul`
`+ mapOfCompatibleSMul'`
`+ mapOfCompatibleSMul_surjective`
`+ mapOfCompatibleSMul_tmul`
`+ tensorProduct_compatibleSMul`
`+ tensorSelfAlgEquiv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I believe this follows from `B âŠ—[A] C = B âŠ—[R] C` for localization (or even epi) `R -> A`. Is it hard to get this general statement?

It should be easy to construct the map from `B âŠ—[R] C` to `B âŠ—[A] C` using the tensorProduct_compatibleSMul which gives you [TensorProduct.smul_tmul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/TensorProduct/Basic.html#TensorProduct.smul_tmul). (The other map always exists and is surjective given `IsScalarTower R A B/C`; is it somewhere in mathlib?)

Okay I'm still not sure if it's okay to add these rather than splitting files but I'll leave this up to some maintainer.
Otherwise LGTM
maintainer merge

Can you please fix the error?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11783036148/job/32819377818)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
def equivOfCompatibleSMul [CompatibleSMul A R M N] : M âŠ—[A] N â‰ƒâ‚—[A] M âŠ—[R] N where
```

@erdOne You should be able to get the general isomorphism for epi R -> A by exhibiting the CompatibleSMul instance similar to tensorProduct_compatibleSMul for the localization case. I added the isomorphism for localization as an example.

What's this?
Should this be here or somewhere in nolint

It needs to be added (at the end of the file, e.g. [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/16c9d8c2fba7254dbeb6e41eeb0554c23e5776ec/Mathlib/Data/List/Basic.lean#L2319)) when #lines exceeds 1500

```suggestion
/-- If the R- and A-actions on M and N satisfy `CompatibleSMul` both ways,
then `M âŠ—[A] N` is canonically isomorphic to `M âŠ—[R] N`. -/
def equivOfCompatibleSMul [CompatibleSMul A R M N] : M âŠ—[A] N â‰ƒâ‚—[A] M âŠ—[R] N where
```
Do we also have a version of this for modules? E.g. take a Q-vector space, and tensor it over Z with Q, then you get the same vector space.

I added this as [an example](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18744/commits/122e2c73e3564888406329e68a5daab6ca22e793#diff-9e7f4ae32a2e11bf6b9c3cd40f4af9f660c7adf15dd698438cc2b54796410b6aR71-R73) and slightly refactored `tensorSelfAlgEquiv`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: tensoring a localization with itself does nothing
